div.div: The Time Warner Cable system in Kansas City appears to be freaking out about the rollout of Google Fiber, and for obvious reasons. Google Fiber puts the Time Warner Cable offering to shame.

div.a: Hurricane Sandy's Gift To Killers: New Dumping Grounds

div.div: Two bodies found in areas hit hardest by Hurricane Sandy suggest that wreckage from the storm has created inviting spots for killers to dump bodies.

div.div: FOOD PORN ALL OVER THE PLACE

div.a: Thanksgiving Day Instagram Pics Break Records

div.div: In total, Thanksgiving Day 2012 "broke all Instagram records," the company said, making it the company's "busiest day so far." The number of shared photos on Turkey Day was more than double those shared on Wednesday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10rWuif&via=Digg&text=Thanksgiving Day Instagram Pics Break Records

div.a: The Abortion Rate Just Hit An All-Time Low — But Why?

div.div: After years of holding steady, new Center for Disease Control data shows that the United States abortion rate has fallen to an all-time low.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TTXZi9&via=Digg&text=The Abortion Rate Just Hit An All-Time Low — But Why?

div.a: 8 Iconic Moments In World of Warcraft History

div.div: To celebrate the game’s eighth birthday, the Daily Dot listed some of the most memorable moments, including mass murders at funerals, worldwide plagues, and city-wide massacres.

div.a: From Nerdy Bikini Model To Japanese Politician

div.div: Politicians with, let's say, interesting backgrounds are nothing new. People have entered politics from acting, modeling, and, yes, even hardcore pornography. Jobs are jobs. Politics, however, is a calling.

div.a: A Sorry State: Pop Marketing And Rihanna's 'Unapologetic'

div.div: Provocation for Profit? Assault as a Marketing Accessory? Why the Rihanna PR Machine show sad signs of our times.

div.div: Nic Reeger, a war veteran, guitar player, and longtime doorman at a historic apartment building in Manhattan, lost everything he owned—including his collection of 5,000 record albums—in the storm.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U1b9Mo&via=Digg&text=The Homeless Doorman

div.div: Tonight, IFC debuts to the world the latest chapters of R. Kelly's musical serial/hip-hopera/brilliant exercise in absurd storytelling, Trapped In The Closet. But before you wade back into the drama surrounding Sylvester, Gwendolyn, Cathy, Twan, and everyone else, refresh your memory with this helpful infographic tracking the main characters through Chapters 1 through 22.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UWOfVq&via=Digg&text='Trapped In The Closet' Flowchart

div.div: Associated Press photographer Bernat Armangué tells the story behind some of his images that have featured on front pages around the world in the last week.

div.a: Who's Really To Blame For The Wal-Mart Strikes?

div.div: The body pillow weighs two pounds and costs $34.95, far less than the dinner tabs for all of the failed dates that could eventually lead to finding a real-life sleepmate. Its comfortable arm makes for a peaceful sleeping experience without having to worry about annoying things like breathing, snoring or night terrors.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T9oi4Y&via=Digg&text=Introducing The Boyfriend Body Pillow

div.a: Company Takes On Google With Augmented Reality Glasses

div.div: The next computing battleground could be on your head, with an Australian company taking on giants like Google and Microsoft with wearable computers in the form of glasses that appear to be straight out of a sci-fi flick.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UVW3GN&via=Digg&text=Company Takes On Google With Augmented Reality Glasses

div.a: Road Built Around House In China

div.div: A couple's home in eastern China has been turned into a roundabout after a road was built around it, when they refused to move out.

div.a: Destroyed Roller Coaster Could Be Jersey Shore Tourist Attraction

div.div: The roller coaster that was swept right-side up into the Atlantic Ocean as Hurricane Sandy slammed the Jersey Shore may not be torn down, according to Seaside Heights Mayor Bill Akers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tive3h&via=Digg&text=Destroyed Roller Coaster Could Be Jersey Shore Tourist Attraction

div.a: NFL's 'Dirtiest Player' Kicks QB In Groin
